description: From Middle English fryghten, equivalent to fright +â€Ž -en.

verbs.description: frighten (third-person singular simple present frightens, present participle frightening, simple past and past participle frightened)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause to feel fear; to scare; to cause to feel alarm or fright.
examples: Avery puts a sheet over her head, pretending to be a ghost to frighten Emily.
